"Hmm. I suppose that it won't hurt to watch, from a safe distance." Malinda says. "I still can't believe that my girls all insisted on attending her games so many times, and I'm honestly surprised that I lost all but Natalie to anything but them."

"Hmm." Candice thinks. "Perhaps Olivia gives a bit of an advantage to those she likes." She muses. "Anyway, let's head on down, shall we?"
121111111222.title: Three's compa- nevermind.

1211111112221.content:
When they come down they see Olivia still darting around the room chatting with girls left and right.
Candice waves her over.

“So what are you up to this time Olivia?”

“Oh, hi! Long time, no see.” She smiles “And I'm trying to organize a game of poker, you in?”

“Ehh, no.” Candice had to admit she was tempted, but at the same time she already had a three girl belly-filler. “We would however like to watch.”

Olivia snarled “You know I really don't like people who want the show, but not the stakes, but al-right, for old times sake. But then you have to promise to make sure no one else tries to get a free show and make sure that the girls that lose don't escape the punishment of losing. Okay?”

“I guess I can live with that.” Malinda agreed, to which Candice added a nodding “Sure.”

It wasn't long after that that everyone had gathered in the room next to where the three TAs' clothes still garnished the floor. Here they had put a couple of tables together to make one large enough to fit all participants.

“Alright people, cough up your passengers so they can join in. I'd prefer if I only have to go over the rules once.” Olivia said loud enough to get everyone's attention and as a result a few girls coughed up a few more attendees, making it a grand total of twelve players, plus Candice and Malinda as acting guards.

“The rules are fairly simple, it's standard Texas hold'em with limited bets, which means that bets are the same as the large blind for the pre-flop and the flop rounds and twice the big blind for the turn and river rounds.
The blinds will be two equal blind bets of five each.”

“Then there are the house rules which makes things interesting.”

“Everyone starts will a hundred in markers, these are your full health and you're not allowed to leave the table unless you have at least a hundred markers to remove from the game, unless the game is over of course.”

“If a player becomes bankrupt, then she must remain anyway, but is out of the game. Other players may chose to remove a hundred markers from the game, which represents the markers the bankrupt player entered the game with. Buying a bankrupt player makes her your bitch for the rest of the game and an hour after as well.
However in order to be able to buy, you must have at least one hundred markers left after the purchase, in other words you need at least two hundred in order to buy someone.”

“To make things a little more interesting no player may hold more than three hundred markers at anyone point, unless there are no broke players to buy. This means that if you have three hundred in markers, you have to buy a girl if or when one is available.”

“Also, seeing as we are....twelve players, the game ends with a final auction when sixhundred markers have been removed from the game. The auction has all the remaining players with more than a hundred markers bid on any remaining broke players.”

“When the auction is over, the game is over and the remaining players can leave the table and any bitches should do as their new owners tells them.”

“Any questions?”

“Yeah, what if someone buys a girl and then goes bankrupt herself and gets bought?” Iris asked as she looked forward to possible intricate developments of the game.

“Well the order still applies, the first bankrupt girl is still the bitch of the second, though her owner in turn might make demands of course.”

Seeing no one else raising any questions Olivia produced a case of makers and removed twelve-hundred in fives and tens, which she distributed to the players so that each had a hundred in markers.
She then produced a card deck and after some thorough shuffling and with the blind bets having been pitched in, she dealt each player two cards, which meant that the game was afoot.

Seated at the table, going clockwise from the lithe, red-headed Olivia, who was the dealer for the first hand of the game, were Carol, then Alex, who were the ones placing in the blind bets for this hand. Then Gina, who'd be the one starting the actual betting.
After Gina sat Vera, another redhead with long vibrant hair. She was followed by Cindy, a lusciously long haired blonde. Following her in turn was Wendy and then the short Mindy, whom had her bleach blonde hair a bit matted, as she was still wet from Vera having brought her along.
Then there was Mary, the curvaceous girl, with a short mop of black hair, who had a similar appearance from having gotten there inside Cindy's gut.
Next in line Was Helen, who stroked her belly with a wanton feeling, having just been made to release Iris, who was the last, sitting next to Olivia, but between her and Helen, Sarah had squeezed her self in and she was trying to keep her dark hair from falling back into her face while she awaited her cards.

Gina, first after the blinds had the opportunity to start the betting and decided to do so.
Vera tagged along not wanting to quit before seeing the flop at least, but Cindy folded while Wendy didn't. Mindy too decided to fold, while Mary raised the bet, causing Helen and Sarah to fold.
Iris decided to call, as did Olivia.

With her blind bet counting towards her bet, Carol would only need to put in another five, but she still decided to fold. Alex however joined in and the remaining girls matched Mary's bet to see the flop.

As Carol was out, this left Alex to bet, but she decided to just check, as did everyone else, so Olivia stepped in and raised a five. “Can't have such a chicken-game, can we?” She teased, not showing a hint that she only had a pair of threes and a knight kicker so far. Still it caused Alex and Vera to fold, who'd both been hoping for a flush, but with three different colours in the flop there was little hope of that.

The rest tagged along though and Mary even considered raising the bet again as her pair of kings felt pretty solid with a nine being the high card in the flop.

The turn revealed another three and didn't inspire much confidence in anyone but Olivia even though it meant that three of the five remaining girls had two pairs, one of those were on the table and it also made Iris give up her hopes of getting a straight, so when Olivia again raised the bet she decided to fold. The other remaining girls also considered it as the bets were now ten at a time, but they all stayed in the game.

A ten of diamonds was what the river flushed out and again only Olivia raised the stakes Making Gina fold, but Wendy and Mary decided to call and see it through to the showdown.

“What's his name?” Olivia said and presented her lurking jack “...then three, three and three.” She added pointing first at the table and then revealing the last three from her hand. A hand that beat both Wendy's nines and threes and Mary's kings and threes and making her claim the pot of a hundred and seventy, bringing her to a total of twohundred and thirtyfive.

Malinda wasn't surprised that Olivia had won the hand, but she had no idea how she would have been able to cheat, three of a kind in threes with that many players wasn't exactly the most solid hand either.

Olivia then turned over the deck to Carol, who'd be the dealer for the next hand.
1211111112221.title: Hold'em then...

12111111122211.content:
Carol dealt the hole cards and Vera started the betting, which made Wendy, Mindy, Mary and Sarah fold, but the rest called her bet.
As confident as most had been before the flop they all decided to check once it was revealed the turn made Vera bet and thus Cindy, Olivia and Carol fold. A wise choice considering that the river revealed a jack of hearts, which would have helped neither of them.

It made Alex cocky enough to bet though, as it meant that with the two jacks on the table she now had three of a kind with king-queen kickers. Gina folded, not quite trusting her tens and jacks to be up for the challenge, Vera too felt that two pairs wouldn't do even if her kings were better than Gina's tens.

Helen and Iris had both considered folding earlier with both holding two hearts that followed one another they had hoped for either straight or flush and the flop had only granted them one heart, but it had meant that Helen would only need one more card for a straight so she'd kept in and Iris had gotten a pair which was the little encouragement she needed to keep going. They had both been surprised when the turn and river turned up two more hearts giving them both flush, so they saw no trouble in meeting Alex's bet, Helen even raised it.

That's when Alex realised that there were three hearts on the table and got cold feet, so she chickened out, making Helen and Iris reveal their cards and to Iris's disappointment she saw that together with the five of hearts from the flop they would have had a straight flush, the problem being that she held the lower cards of the straight, meaning that the pot of a hundred and forty went to Helen, but worse, it brought herself down to only fifty! She really needed to win a hand now, hopefully Alex would give her some good cards.

It was not the case, she folded along with most of the girls when Cindy started betting. She didn't bet after the flop though, only Olivia did which caused everyone to fold and she downright frowned at the meagre winnings, she hadn't had jack shit though so perhaps she shouldn't complain, even if her chances for a straight had been pretty high.

Seeing how many joined in on Gina's hand Olivia, while not letting anything show, still cursed that she'd gotten cards that she couldn't possibly win with, she also gave Sarah a strange look, the girl hadn't entered a single hand, bad luck, or just cowardice?

Olivia wasn't less annoyed when she saw Wendy raise and everyone but Vera follow.

On the turn no-one bet. So Carol gave it a try and was awarded with everyone but Wendy tossing in their cards. And on the river, Wendy didn't bet so she tried the same thing again and saw Wendy too give up and she could collect the winnings, that wasn't by a long-shot what Olivia had initially thought they might become. Still it brought her into the safe zone with a total of a hundred and sixty.

When Vera started dealing Wendy was a little anxious to even pay the blind as doing so brought her down to a mere thirty five, many of the other girls were more pleased by the facts that girls were finally getting into danger and that it wasn't them.

Again everyone checked, so Olivia put forth a bet, which caused most girls to fold, she wasn't surprised that Sarah was amongst them. The flop revealed a pair of eights and figuring she couldn't bluff her way out of it, she folded like everyone else when Cindy put forth her bet. The measly winnings were even less than Olivia had received earlier and it only brought Cindy to an even hundred.

Cindy's hand turned out to be one with more participants, even if Sarah unsurprisingly decided to yet again fold as soon as the betting started. Then Carol raised eventhough it was pre-flop, which only caused poor Wendy to fold in order to save her remaining thirty for a better hand.

The flop revealed a pair of aces and colours no one wanted, so when Mary dared a bet, Helen, Olivia and Mindy pulled out, while Carol again raised it, but it didn't cause any more to leave.

She tried again at the turn, which made Mary toss in her cards, finding the extra ten a bit much when she only had thirtyfive left.

Again she bet at the river and again Cindy called, forcing them to a showdown, where Carol's aces and queens beat Cindy's aces and fives.

Carol was glad she had kept betting, her cards might not have been that good, but obviously good enough and it had given her the best winnings in a while, which brought her into the lead, much to Olivia's dismay, even if it was just a five marker lead.

Wendy's hand brought the surprise that Sarah joined, it would have been even more surprising if they had known that she didn't even have a decent hold. Though she folded once the flop was revealed, but then again so did everyone except Mindy and Helen. And when Mindy again bet on the Turn Helen also folded.
Olivia was pleased with the result if for no other reason than that Sarah was now no longer allowed to leave the table, in fact only four girls were, herself, Carol, Helen and Mindy.
Then again why would you want to leave when you're ahead?

Mindy did like Olivia had done in her turn, she raised the bet when it came around to her, half the girls were already out by then, but the ones that weren't accepted the increase in order to see the flop. But when Helen bet after it, she folded, leaving it a contest between Sarah and Helen no less, a contest Sarah won with a single pair of aces.

Mary's hand had Mary herself folding and Helen raising the bet before the flop, making it a good start, because most decided to join. The pair of twos that came up turned it into a betting match which made all but the three in the lead fold.

The turn saw Carol betting and the other two calling, the river saw Helen betting, Olivia folding and Carol raising the bet, only to have Helen raise it further, which gave Carol cold feet, so she decided to call, a stake of sixty was quite enough, half the girls around the table hadn't had that much for a while.
So it was all down to the showdown, where Carol displayed her three of a kind, only to see that the nine of clubs that the river had brought had turned Helen's two pairs into a full house, the best hand so far in the game and the largest pot, but since it was a bit of a duel the winnings were probably not the best.

Still the hundred and nintyfive pot, brought Helen over the threehundred mark, so if there had been a broke girl she would have been forced to buy her. A fact that made Helen play a bit with her long wavy auburn hair as she gave the almost broke girls really inviting come-hither glances, which left little doubt as to why Iris ended up inside Helen's stomach as often as she did.

Then it was Helen's hand, which brought first the surprise of everyone folding after Olivia's bet and then that it was raised by Mary, who was down to her last twenty, meaning half of it was already placed in bets. As she now had money to spare, Helen joined, just for fun.

This time Sarah and Olivia checked and Mary was the one to bet, the flop had given Helen a pair of eights so she figured she might just as well continue, she could afford to lose the money and she really felt like annoying Mary and raised the bet. Which would force Mary to spend her last marker. Sarah and Olivia both folded, which surprised her.

Mary decided to call, it was all or nothing now, unfortunately for her, 'all' was not a whole lot, so even if she did win, she'd still be piss poor. Something that wouldn't change since only she and Helen remained and she was out of money, so there was no further betting.
And it really didn't help that she'd been hoping for a flush, but the flop didn't reveal a single spades to match her six and king, which meant that flush was a lost cause.

The turn revealed a six of hearts, which at least gave her a pair, but Helen's pair of eights would beat that, it was all down to the last card. Funny, as Helen had thought of folding at the pre-flop, since a four of diamonds and an eight of hearts really wasn't something to brag about.

It was all down to the river... a jack of spades! Totally useless for both parties, but more or less everyone else that had already folded would have had a straight either queen or jack high with the cards on the table, since four of them had had a seven on hand and a different four girls had had a queen, but now it was all won with:

“A pair of eights.” Helen smiled as she revealed her cards that just barely out-gunned Mary's already revealed pair of sixes.

Putting a hundred in markers on the table she turned to Mary. “Now you get over here. I've been wanting something in my stomach ever since I had to let go of Iris.”

The sultry look she gave Mary struck the right cords, so Mary didn't say anything, she just wanted to feel Helen suck and lick her body all over as soon as possible and got out of her chair and offered the girl her arms, in fact forcing them into Helen's mouth as she turned to accept her meal.

Mary wasn't disappointed, Helen quickly sucked much of her in, but once there she sucked and slurped her delicious morsel quite thoroughly, clearly enjoying herself, so long before Mary slipped out of view most girls were either envious of her, or of Mary.

But then Helen found it a bit hard to sit at the table with a Mary-bulge in her gut, so she decided to hide the girl. That wouldn't stop her from enjoying her, so after adjusting her seat she kept idly caressing her smooth flat belly, that didn't show a hint of the girl it contained.
12111111122211.title: A few hands...

121111111222111.content:
“Now where were we?” She asked no-one in particular, wearing a mischievous smile. “”Oh right...” She said and passed the deck to Sarah, the markers she'd paid for Mary stood as a marker in the center of the table.

Though Sarah didn't hold the deck for long, before the flop all had folded, but the three in the lead and after the flop Carol placed a bet and the other two folded as well giving her the minuscule pot.

Then it was Iris's hand, which had Wendy joining the fight and a raise on the pre-flop which made Olivia chicken out, only to regret it once she saw the flop, which would have given her three of a kind, but that couldn't be helped now.

Mindy was the one to lead and the rest called her bet. Then the turn only interested Helen, who was the only one who saw any use for the revealed seven of hearts, but she still didn't have a flush, so far Mindy's tens and threes were the winning hand, but the river could change everything, so both feeling rather confident in her hand and trying to get a few more to bail out she decided to bet, yet again, which indeed made both Carol and Wendy fold, leaving it a match between herself and Helen.

The river was a nine...of...hearts. Mindy didn't bet, but Helen did, making Mindy call her, only to find that Helen's flush totally trashed her two pairs.

Collecting her winnings she counted her markers to be sure then she grinned as she patted her stomach. “Okay, who's next?” Helen taunted, hinting that she had yet again passed the threehundred threshold. The other girls tried to ignore her even if Wendy tried to hide a little and Iris gave her marker-stack a suspicious look.

With that they had made it one lap around the table and it was Olivia's turn again to be the dealer.

Surprisingly Wendy was the one to start the betting, perhaps more surprising was that only Iris and Olivia followed and both raised the bet, meaning that Wendy had to toss in all her markers to call.
The flop didn't impress anyone, so everyone checked, the turn was little better, it brought Wendy a seven of hearts which she could have used for a straight flush, but the flop had ruined both chances of a straight or a flush. The way she saw it, her only hope lay in the other two folding, how that would happen she just couldn't figure out though.

That left the river, which tossed forth a jack of diamonds, that made Olivia bet and Iris fold, but ultimately changed nothing, for prior to it Olivia's pair of twos had been high and eventhough the jack gave Iris a pair of jacks, it also gave Olivia the same, leaving Wendy with jack shit.

“Come here Wendy...” Helen leered, placing another hundred in markers on the table. “Sorry to say, but Mary wasn't very filling...” she teased. ”Could sure use your help with that...”

Reluctantly Wendy got up and walked over to Helen, who promptly picked the girl up and fiddled for a while, until she was holding Wendy by her thighs and waist. That way when she held the girl up, she got great access to her moist center. And after some attention to that part Wendy didn't seem so upset about losing any more, when Helen shoved the girls whole hips into her mouth and sucked her like a hard candy, Wendy couldn't have uttered a sentient word even if she'd tried.
Then in mid climax she disappeared with a wet slurping noise.

Helen licked her lips, then wiped her face, finally licking her fingers clean of the collected moisture, before adjusting her seat and turn to idly caressing her belly while she waited for the next deal.

She didn't comment with a single word and she casually ignored the stares of the other girls.

Her second snack had cost her the lead though, now Olivia was ahead, with a full five-marker.
121111111222111.title: One down...

1211111112221111.content:
Carol dealt the holds with Vera placing a bet and Cindy raising that, surprisingly only causing Mindy, Carol and Alex to fold.
The flop, being a mixed blessing caused Gina to bet, but no-one raised or folded, though Iris was out of markers, so she just hoped the pot would get big and that she'd win somehow.

The turn produced a king of diamonds, making it three diamonds on the table but no one had any but Olivia who held the ace, and sincerely hoped for another diamond in the river, though the king went well with her king of spades too, so she decided to bet, which made half of the girls fold.

The river, a ten of spades, didn't sit well with her, she could still place a bet, but Gina had little to lose, she only had another five, and Iris was out of money since the pre-flop, so she checked.

The showdown had Gina reveal her pair of nines with king-jack-ten kickers, Iris had only a pair of twos, with ace-king-jack kickers and Olivia finally showed her pair of kings, with ace-jack-ten kickers.

Now she was curious how much markers she had, Iris was broke and Gina down to her final five-marker. The pot had been a hundred and twentyfive, which brought her up to a total of threehundred and twenty.

With a grin on her face Olivia placed a hundred on the table next to the two stacks of markers Helen had placed there earlier, before turning to Iris, who was seated next to her, just like Mary had been to Helen.

“Head, or feet first?” was all Olivia said to the girl, who was examining Olivia's body.

“Ehh, feet...” Iris said and still sitting, lifted her legs up and offered Olivia her feet.

Olivia gave them a lick continuing halfway up the shins, before placing them both in her mouth and started sucking the girl in. She wasn't hurrying along, but she wasn't really taking her time either, so Iris disappeared as a steady pace.

To Iris's dismay Olivia didn't pause to enjoy her at any point, she was given a thorough tasting, but that was pretty much it. She tried protesting a couple of times but Olivia silenced her and before long her head slipped in between Olivia's lips, leaving a large bulge that travelled down the redhead's neck before joining the large dome in her gut.

Like Helen before her Olivia too noticed that it was hard to sit at the table with a large gut, at least if you were facing it, she dismissed the thought of sitting sideways, so she too hid her meal, the bulge shrank rapidly until all that was left was her trim belly.

Olivia also caressed her belly with a pleased expression covering her face, with her meal hidden she could digest at leisure and there was little need to force it along much, that'd only risk the process getting loud enough for the other girls to notice.

Though Iris, still noticed.

She had been intrigued at first, she had wondered what Olivia's stomach would be like. Now she would get to experience it and more of its features than she wanted to.

Her screams didn't carry outside her prison though, she was too well hidden for that. She could only struggle fruitlessly as Olivia slowly turned her to a nutritious soup while the game continued outside.

Olivia had been peckish for a while now, since the game started in fact, so it wasn't some grudge against Iris or anything. Anyone that would have ended up in there would have gotten the grand tour, Iris was just unlucky.

Rubbing her belly Olivia enjoyed the shifts inside, she'd relish the feeling as the girl would struggle to sate her appetite as her intestines would greedily absorb what it wanted. She idly wondered if Iris would succeed, she kind of doubted it...she already had an appetite for seconds, which didn't speak in the girl's favour.
1211111112221111.title: Aaaand another one goes...

12111111122211111.content:
Inside Helen things were not quite as rough, though it had been close a moment ago, for Mary had decided to eat the new arrival. In the dark she couldn't quite get her aim right, which had led to her not getting the girl when she was vulnerable from both her recent climax as well as being dumped into the dark stomach.

This led to Mary struggling to get a hold on the taller girl, but Wendy knew what was up and put up a fight, much to Helen's delight.
Mary was the stronger and more skilled of the two, so if it hadn't been for the darkness and the slipperiness and the moving floor and walls, the struggle would no doubt have been quite short. Now as it were, it lasted for at least a couple of hands. But in the end Wendy was unable to keep herself from going down yet another throat and once she was trapped inside Mary's bulging belly, there was no more commotion in Helen's stomach, Mary even laid down to relax.

Outside Alex was dealing and the blind, made Gina pitch in her last marker. This was it, all or nothing...

It looked good jack and queen of spades, now all she could hope for was a large pot and that too looked promising as when Cindy placed a bet everyone called.

The flop revealed seven of spades...ten of diamonds...and...king of hearts...
Gina still has hopes, it looked worse at first than it was, a nine or an ace will give her a straight and it is still possible for two more spades although unlikely.

As the flop didn't inspire too much confidence, Helen placed a bet to weed some people out, the king had given her a pair, which was at least something.
Her plan succeeded as four girls folded.

The turn then placed a six of clubs on the table to Cindy's delight, since it meant that she now had three of a kind, which meant that she decided to bet, forcing anyone but Gina who wanted to tag along to pitch in another ten, but everyone folded, so that just left her and Gina.

And the river revealed a seven of clubs, giving her a full house, Gina in turn had naught but the pair of seven that were on the table, making her broke and up for sale.
For Cindy the winnings brought her back from the brink of ruin to a more steady hundred and five.

With Gina out, the deal went to Vera, who apparently provided Cindy with another good hand, a pair of tens in the hold and the flop revealed another ten, giving her three of a kind.
So she bet, but none raised though several girls called because they figured they could afford it, like Helen, who had eight and jack in hearts, but with the flop consisting of ten of clubs, seven of spades and three of hearts her hand didn't look that great.

The turn revealed a nine of diamonds though, which changed things a bit.

Cindy still placed a bet and Helen raised it, causing Sarah and Carol to fold and it did make Cindy wary, so she only called.

Unfortunately for her the river was an eight of diamonds, so she tried to play it safe and check, but Helen raised and with three tens she didn't feel like folding, so a call brought them to the showdown where Helen revealed her seven to jack straight.

At least she wasn't in deep trouble just yet Cindy tried convincing herself, counting her markers to sixtyfive, before she received the deck to deal.

It turned into a bit of a raffle, raise both on the pre-flop and the flop, though by then Cindy was the only one with a small purse still in the game.
And with Carol raising the bets she was a little anxious when the turn placed another nine on the table, since that was a pair everyone could use, still with it she had two pairs, question was if to fold or not, another ten markers in the bet would have almost halved her funds and there was still the river to come...

She decided to fold...

When the river revealed a four of clubs Olivia and Helen did the same, so Carol didn't even have to show her hand, she could just grin and collect the winnings which were significant, eventhough they were now down to only eight players.

Gina gave her a worrying look as she counted her markers and Carol replied with an “Almost, but not quite.” She could still buy Gina if she felt like it though, but she decided to hold on to the markers for now.

Mindy's hand had Vera entering and Cindy decided to chance it, so she even raised the pre-flop to Vera's dismay, the girl had been down to fifteen, so this meant that if she wanted to see the flop, she'd be down to her last five.

The flop had Cindy bet, only to see everyone, but Helen pull out, so she decided to be bold and bet on the turn as well and to her jot, Helen too folded, allowing her to claim the much needed markers.

Helen's hand had everyone, but her, Sarah and Olivia fold on the pre-flop, so it was quick, with Olivia folding on the turn and Sarah on the river.

Then Vera decided to join in with her final five and was a little unnerved when everyone but Sarah and Olivia folded, even if she won she wouldn't get any winnings worth mentioning.

At least the other two kept betting against one another, but that hardly helped for the flop had only given her a pair and the turn hadn't helped.

She let on a small smile when she saw the river though, now she had two pairs, sixes and eights, neither of which was on the table.
Sarah kept betting though and surprisingly Olivia folded.

Vera was first to show, her six and eight both of diamonds went well with the eight of clubs from the flop and the six of hearts from the river.
Sarah only smiled though as she put forth her five and ace of diamonds, which together with the ace of spades from the flop and the five of hearts from the turn handed her the win.

This meant that Vera too found herself broke, and could only watch with trepidation on Helen and Carol's huge stacks of markers, even if neither seemed that eager to spend them just yet.

Olivia's flop turned interesting as Alex pitched in her last marker, no one folded though, even if Helen hesitated, the stakes weren't that high yet and she did have markers to spare.

Lucky for her too as the turn revealed a queen, which was the unlikely card she needed to get a straight. Obviously she raised the stakes and was a little sorry to see both Olivia and Mindy fold and as Alex was out of markers that only left river and showdown. A four of diamonds changed nothing and Alex only had a pair of kings.

That meant a third broke girl for the market and Helen back in the lead with twohundred and eightyfive in markers.

Carol's hand was the cheapest so far, the showdown was over a pot of mere twenty. It went to Sarah for her pair of ace and ten-kicker where the kicker gave her the win over Mindy who had a pair of ace as well, but only a nine-kicker.

As pathetic as Carol's hand had been, Cindy's handed the pot of fifteen to Mindy, just barely beating Helen's hand with the third kicker card after the pair of fives that were on the table.

Mindy's hand proved more promising, before the flop only Olivia had folded and looking at the modest flop of two, four and ace, Mindy realized that with her three and five of diamonds, she had a low straight, ace to five. Helen had two pairs twos and fours, so she was pretty pleased as well, the others were less pleased though and folded as Helen put in a bet.

Not that Mindy did mind, she raised the bet, making Helen call her to see it through to the turn, but the ace of spades changed nothing, so Mindy pitched in her last markers, this was indeed all or nothing and Helen called once again.

The river placed king of hearts on the table, but as Mindy was out of markers it went straight to the showdown where Helen revealed her two pairs, so Mindy was quite pleased when she could collect the pot, she was still placed last in the running, but at least now she'd have her head above water.
12111111122211111.title: Game stalls...broke something?

121111111222111111.content:
Mindy hadn't noticed yet what made Cindy a little uneased. The fact that there were three girls available for purchase, and when they were, the game would be over. But no one that had the markers seemed interested in doing so just yet, which might mean that they would have to be forced to buy another three before the game would end and then all the broke girls would be auctioned out. In short, there would probably just be three or four girls left playing when the game would end and she was by no means in the lead, in fact she only had fifteen more than Mindy, who despite her win remained in last place.

Helen interrupted her line of thoughts as another hand was dealt, an interesting one at that, no one folded, eventhough Helen raised the bet. Then the flop revealed three hearts, two, four and five.
It didn't sit perfect with Carol's two eights, but one of them was heart as well, so she raised and saw all but Mindy and Olivia call.
The queen of diamonds complicated things, which was why everyone called Helen's bet, which made the pot quite interesting.
The river produced four of clubs, not what anyone had hoped for.
Carol tried a bluff, two pairs wasn't much when one of them was on the table.

info.brief_description: What if shady classes should be held in secret at your local university? F/any vore.
info.description:
To the readers:
At the top of the page there's my name and a letter next to it, clicking that lets you send me an email
Further at the top of every chapter is likewise a letter next to the author of said chapter, clicking that will let you send an email to hat author.
Please do comment.
If emails isn't your thing, or if you want to discuss something more publicly, then go here:
http://aryion.com/forum/viewtopic.php?f=22&t=20419&start=0


To authors:
I really hope you want to add to this story I'm piecing together here and I'm very grateful for all the help I can get.
I will be readily available for modding, sometimes you get an idea and would like to have a chapter moved or branched or just edited. I do read the mail here if not every day and I am available at Eka's, if you know where that is. (Eka's is better since I get a notification for new private messages.)

Further the contents of the story can be discussed here:

http://aryion.com/forum/viewtopic.php?f=22&t=20419&start=0
------------------------------------------
Basic rules:
Only human female predators, only humans as "people", that is no furries or mutants or other not naturally occurring things, that includes ghosts and other supernatural things such as soul-talk and thus soul-vore. (Soul-music is allowed though, but only just. :P )
No magic, vore might be weird but try to keep it pseudo-scientific.
No unbirth.
And keep in mind this is a semi-real world scenario, digestive tracts does digest stuff put in it. However predators are trained here, if someone isn't being digested it's because the predator is skilled enough and holding back, possibly because the prey is her practice partner from class.
Thorough digestion is encouraged.
Because of the constant teaching of new predators there will be quite a few of them so if plenty of them get digested there are more still lurking nearby.

Oh, and please keep the characters roughly the same in each thread even if events play out very differently. That is if Kim is a short blonde who's afraid of horses in one thread then please keep her that way if you include her in other threads, similarly it would be convenient if she had the same friends and family members in all threads (ok so you can kill some off, but don't have a Stephanie big sister in one and Stephanie being the name of the mom in another.)
Consistency, like this enables writers and readers to get to know the characters better without expanding every thread into huge novels by themselves.

Options:
At the end of every chapter a writer can usually leave two alternative options for readers to follow, or writers to add to. Please try to formulate these as character choices or similar non-predetermined outcome choices.
Example:
1: A thinks "I should eat that damn B-itch!" (alt: A tries to eat B.)
2: A thinks "I don't dare, but B really deserves to get eaten." (alt: A decides now might not be the best time to eat B.)
That is A LOT better than the nowadays common:
1: A eats B
2: B eats A
Which both ruins the suspense of what’s going to happen because the option is already a synopsis of the coming chapter, which also means that there’s no freedom for the writer who would add to the chapter, meaning that those chapters are often left hanging.
This is a classic occasion where I can mod, if you have a good idea to follow up on a chapter but the choices don’t fit, I’ll change the options in a jiffy, just write anyway and email or PM me.

The story was started before the stupid 10000 character limit rule, so I can't edit chapters that are larger than that. (Which is quite a few of the older ones. So unfortunately the options in those will remain weird.)

Oh, and I still have a few ideas that I want to fit in, so if you add to the "1" option in the “111111...”-string at I might move your chapter to the “2” option, if it doesn’t fit with the turn of events I have planned.
Any other threads, options and whatnot, are up for grabs though.  Please add and have fun!

Alright on with the story:
----------------------------------------------------------


First day

It was a strange feeling, she never knew what to expect and every year it was the same thing. Usually they’d be well behaved, which was a load off her chest at any rate, but would they be interested and would they hold any potential at all?

The professor had to admit to herself that she was glad this wasn’t taught at grade school level. Nowadays kids are obnoxious brats, granting them the knowledge and power that her students can archive if they are lucky and willing, is a nightmare she’s glad she’s not going to have to put up with. Although admittedly it would have meant that if some poor schmuck had gone through that hell before the students got to her she wouldn’t have to start from scratch and risk losing the ones with potential to boredom.

There are two sides of every coin, there’s no denying that, even if there are those who try hard to convince themselves and others otherwise.

There’s always the issue of how careful one should proceed, most girls probably don’t know what class they’ve signed up to, seeing as it’s not really what’s in the folders.
Although no doubt a few of them suspect as much seeing as that there aren’t that many classes that have their students sign waivers of disclosure. Well there’s a bit more than that in the waiver, but who reads them anyway? The important thing is that they’re not allowed in class without having signed one, so that should be the end of that.

Still there’s always the risk of dropouts either from boredom if one proceed to slowly and on the other hand it’s all too easy to scare students away as well, neither of course is desirable because you never know who it is that leaves. Losing a few good for nothing talent-less students she could care less about, but potential researchers for her team is another matter.

“Well there’s no need stalling it any further.” Professor Blainey thought to herself as she got up and straightened her suit before heading to the lecture hall. The teaching assistants should all ready be there and so should the new students for this year’s vore class, or ‘A feminist perspective on modern biology’ with the course code v101 as it was listed in the catalogue it’d all start as soon as she was ready and as far as she could tell she was.
